title: WTA Calls for Investigation Into Peng Shuai Sexual-Assault Allegations Against a Former Chinese Leader
sub_head: Women’s Tennis Association chairman calls for issue to be handled “without censorship,” risking backlash from Beijing
body:
The Women’s Tennis Association called on the Chinese government to investigate allegations of sexual assault against a former senior official posted on the social media account of professional tennis star Peng Shuai, risking backlash in a country that has punished foreign sports organizations for wading into its domestic politics.
“Peng Shuai, and all women, deserve to be heard, not censored,” WTA chairman and Chief Executive Officer Steve Simon said in a statement released Sunday. “We expect this issue to be handled properly, meaning the allegations must be investigated fully, fairly, transparently and without censorship.”
